page.title: 02A typical farm in Marnhull.
page.content: Most farms in Marnhull are dairy farms,because it's fairly wet and a lot of land is clay,producing thick pasture.We went to visit one on the edge of Marnhull.It was quite big, about 380 acres,plus another little farm down the road with a barn and old buildings.There were 15 fields mostly for silage. No other crops were grown except grass. The main buildings were cattle and calf buildings,one new and one old milking parlour;three barns,one each for silage,hay and straw. For machinery they used six tractors, one plough,two silage trailers, one silager,one grass cutter, one hay turner,one bailer,one round bailer,one hedge cutter and three dung spreaders. There were three full and two part time workers.They actually do contract work for other farmers.
